TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi serializable sealed beforefieldinit Hash extends System.Security.Policy.EvidenceBase implements class System.Runtime.Serialization.ISerializable

Docs.summary: Provides evidence about the hash value for an assembly. This class cannot be inherited.

remarks.format:
## Remarks A hash value represents a unique value that corresponds to a particular set of bytes. Rather than referring to an assembly by name, version, or other designation, a hash value designates the assembly without ambiguity. Names are subject to collisions in rare cases where the same name is given to completely different code. Different variations of code can accidentally be marked with the same version. However, even changing a single bit results in a very different hash value.
Hash values are a cryptographically secure way to refer to specific assemblies in policy without the use of digital signatures. A secure hash algorithm is designed so that it is computationally infeasible to construct a different assembly with the identical hash value by either an accidental or malicious attempt. By default, evidence from the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.SHA1> and <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.MD5> hash algorithms is supported, although any hash algorithm can be used through <xref:System.Security.Policy.Hash.GenerateHash%2A>.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(class System.Reflection.Assembly assembly) cil managed

Docs.param: The assembly for which to compute the hash value.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The hash value computation is not performed until one of the properties or methods is called.

Docs.summary: Creates a new object that is a copy of the current instance.
Docs.returns: A new object that is a copy of this instance.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public static hidebysig class System.Security.Policy.Hash CreateMD5(unsigned int8[] md5) cil managed

Docs.param: A byte array that contains an hash value.
Docs.summary: Creates a object that contains an hash value.
Docs.returns: An object that contains the hash value provided by the parameter.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The returned <xref:System.Security.Policy.Hash> object contains only the <xref:System.Security.Policy.Hash.MD5%2A> property.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public static hidebysig class System.Security.Policy.Hash CreateSHA1(unsigned int8[] sha1) cil managed

Docs.param: A byte array that contains a hash value.
Docs.summary: Creates a object that contains a hash value.
Docs.returns: An object that contains the hash value provided by the parameter.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The returned <xref:System.Security.Policy.Hash> object contains only the <xref:System.Security.Policy.Hash.SHA1%2A> property.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public static hidebysig class System.Security.Policy.Hash CreateSHA256(unsigned int8[] sha256) cil managed

Docs.param: A byte array that contains a hash value.
Docs.summary: Creates a object that contains a hash value.
Docs.returns: A hash object that contains the hash value provided by the parameter.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The returned <xref:System.Security.Policy.Hash> object contains only the <xref:System.Security.Policy.Hash.SHA256%2A> property.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance unsigned int8[] GenerateHash(class System.Security.Cryptography.HashAlgorithm hashAlg) cil managed

Docs.param: The hash algorithm to use to compute the hash value for the assembly.
Docs.summary: Computes the hash value for the assembly using the specified hash algorithm.
Docs.returns: A byte array that represents the hash value for the assembly.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The assembly specified in the class constructor provides the bytes for computing the hash value. The `hashAlg` parameter is an object derived from a specific <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.HashAlgorithm>. The returned hash value is of the type identified by `hashAlg`.

Docs.exception: The hash value for the assembly cannot be generated.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This method is provided to support inheritance of the <xref:System.Runtime.Serialization.ISerializable> interface.

Docs.permission: requires full trust for the immediate caller. This member cannot be used by partially trusted or transparent code.

Docs.summary: Gets the hash value for the assembly.
Docs.value: A byte array that represents the hash value for the assembly.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The assembly specified in the class constructor provides the bytes for the hash computation.
## Examples The following example computes the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.MD5> hash for `myAssembly` and stores it in `hashcode`.

Docs.value: A byte array that represents the hash value for the assembly.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The assembly that is specified in the <xref:System.Security.Policy.Hash.%23ctor%2A> constructor provides the bytes for the hash computation.
